definition: to take care of a matter all by oneself/to run the whole show
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
surname Bao
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: Previously, companies dictated what software and hardware were used for work purposes.
sentences.chinese: 以往，公司就能一手包办定下工作所需软硬件的功能。

sentences.english: Then the little red hen had to do everything herself.
sentences.chinese: 然后小红母鸡就自己一手包办所有事。

sentences.english: Wedding preparation formed by the fusion of flat, can counteract managed manually Yang flower of course back to participate.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼筹备由羽平一手包办，可中和杨朵当然回来参与。

definition: to undertake to do everything by oneself/to run the whole show
to do sth oneself
to do sth in place of sb else
to arrange matters
lit. things are not separated according to their size (idiom)/fig. to deal with any matter, regardless of its importance
to manage/to handle
to take complete charge (idiom)
to attend to everything personally
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
various jobs/low-grade work
to give/to deliver/to hand over
to worry about
to pass through one's hands/to handle/to deal with
household duties/housework
to be in charge of/to take responsibility for/to be to blame/conscientious
to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
